thread.title: Nicola Kidman's unusual clapping technique at Oscars mocked online
thread.title_full: Nicola Kidman's unusual clapping technique at Oscars mocked online

author: Adam Boult
title: Nicola Kidman's unusual clapping technique at Oscars mocked online
text:
A ward ceremonies can be tough going. For the average Hollywood A-lister attending last night's Oscars, all that clapping must have been punishing work on the old hands. 
Who are we, then, to judge Nicole Kidman for what is, by anyone's reckoning, a highly unconventional method of clapping.
The technique - fingers pointed awkwardly outwards, with only the palms touching - was picked up by viewers on social media, prompting a slew of incredulous comment:
Nicole Kidman ain't got a clue how to clap üòê wtf #sealHands #oscars pic.twitter.com/yuh6Zb2ejq 
‚Äî AISLEYNE (@Aisleyne1) 27 February 2017 Why does Nicole Kidman not know how to clap?
‚Äî Erin Martinez (@ErinEMartinez97) 27 February 2017 Nicole Kidman forgot how to clap in the middle of clapping.
‚Äî Luck o' the Parrish (@BennParrish) 27 February 2017 SOMEONE PLEASE TEACH NICOLE KIDMAN HOW TO CLAP pic.twitter.com/5DQFR3M0VV 
‚Äî #1 Rachel ‚ú® (@rachel) 27 February 2017 Nicole Kidman clap made me so happy today
‚Äî SKRILLEX (@Skrillex) 27 February 2017 Why does Nicole Kidman clap like The Grinch?! pic.twitter.com/dhzN7Og8xC 
‚Äî Michael Lopriore (@MichaelLopriore) 27 February 2017 Leave Nicole Kidman alone kids. You'd clap like that too with a ring the size of the Empire State Building twirling around your finger.
‚Äî RocketAce (@VegaOrBust) 27 February 2017 Nicole Kidman's clap game confirms she's a robot
‚Äî KFC (@KFCBarstool) 27 February 2017 I've seen that Nicole Kidman clap before #Oscars pic.twitter.com/XDGlJErwoG 
‚Äî edwin (@edwinthejeans) 27 February 2017 T his isn't the first time Ms Kidman, who was nominated for the Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her role in Lion, has been spotted showcasing her distinctive clap. See this GIF from the 2015 Oscars:
My apologies to Wes Anderson. Nicole Kidman's clap is MUCH weirder... pic.twitter.com/Q0yOVQcm8D 
‚Äî Patrick Thomas (@RadioPatrick) 23 February 2015 M s Kidman's unorthodox clapping style was just one talking point in a ceremony that saw a few surprises - most notably, Warren Beatty reading out the wrong film as winner in the Best Picture category.
Beatty, presenting the award with Faye Dunaway, told the audience that Damien Chazelle's La La Land had claimed the award - when in fact the winner was Barry Jenkins's Moonlight. 
The mistake was only discovered after the team behind La La Land had taken to the stage.
For a full run-down of the evening's event, take a look back over the Telegraph's Oscars 2017 liveblog .
